admin.name: Noopur Shanbhogue
admin.involvements: Was involved with R|P, WiCyS, and was a CA with CS 411
admin.hobbies: hiking, cooking, reading, trying out new bakeries and cafes
admin.advice: It is okay to ask for help and try new things. That you can afford to make mistakes now and grow from it!

admin.name: Rachel Huang
admin.involvements: Asian American Association, Honors Student Council, Research Park
admin.hobbies: Running, playing piano, skiing, hunting for free things, and spending time with friends and family!!
admin.fact: I once went scuba diving in the Great Barrier Reef and it was magical!!
admin.advice: It's so important to have a good work life balance -- I'd recommend joining lots of RSOs you're interested in! Also, office hours are a great resource!

admin.name: Sailaja Nallacheruvu
admin.involvements: Undergraduate Law Review, Girls Who Code, Engineering Student Admissions Representative
admin.hobbies: Listening to Music, Working Out, Reading Books
admin.fact: I have a black belt in Taekwondo!
admin.advice: There's not one right way to do things while you're in school. Keep trying new things because that's the only way to figure out what you really enjoy!

admin.name: Anushree Berlia
admin.fact: I can play three different instruments!
admin.advice: Remember to take things according to your own pace. Try not to overwhelm yourself with a lot of things, it's okay to say no, and try to focus on some specific ones that make you happy :)

admin.name: Ananya Rajagopal
admin.involvements: Research at the Social Computing Lab (SCUBA)
admin.fact: I studied abroad in Stockholm last semester!
admin.advice: Ask questions and reach out to people, even (maybe even especially) if it feels nerve-wrecking to do so! Whether it’s about reaching out to new friends or learning more about a new resource/opportunity, it almost never hurts to ask.

admin.name: Ellie Chang
admin.involvements: Illinois CS Sail, Taiwanese American Students Club, U of I Christians on Campus, University of Illinois Symphony Orchestra violist
admin.interests: AI, human-computer interaction, natural language processing
admin.hobbies: Play viola, hand letter, draw, play Minesweeper (my current record for hard mode is 35 seconds), eating good food with my friends :)
admin.advice: I wish I had realized earlier that it isn't shameful to quit or take a break. I spent a lot of my freshman year overly stressed after I stacked up as many responsibilities as possible, just because I thought dropping a few or quitting would be seen as weak. Remember to respect your own limits and take care of yourself!

admin.name: Grace Zhang
admin.involvements: Software developer for Hack4Impact, Research Park
admin.interests: Web/app dev, CS for social good
admin.hobbies: Reading, cafe hopping (Caffe Paradiso has my heart and wallet), playing badminton, and watching anime (A Place Further than the Universe is a must-watch!)
admin.fact: I haven't woken up later than 8 AM in the past year and a half, including during weekends and over breaks. Over the summer I kept a consistent 6:30 AM wake-up time ^^
admin.advice: Don't be scared! It can be intimidating as a freshman to apply to competitive RSOs or arrive at an event alone, but if you have even the slightest sense that you'd regret not taking the opportunity, steel your nerves and do it :)

admin.name: Shreya Deshpande
admin.hobbies: Hiking, being outdoors, spending time with friends and family
admin.fact: I played the violin in high school
admin.advice: Don’t be afraid to try something new! Join RSOs or go to events that seem interesting, they can be a nice break from stressful school work

admin.name: Anushri Mittal
admin.interests: Web dev, AI, Data Science, HCI
admin.fact: I have touched a crocodile, fed a giraffe, and watched a lionness hunt in Masaimara.

admin.name: Rayna Wuh
admin.involvements: Co-Lead for CS 196, ACM Mentoring Co-Chair, R|P, Daily Illini
admin.interests: Web Dev, Ethics, Human Computer Interactions
admin.hobbies: I love to crochet, read, bake, do yoga, and swim
admin.fact: My middle name is Christine because I was born on Christmas Eve
admin.advice: It's okay not to know exactly what you want to do and you have plenty of room to explore and find new interests :)

admin.name: Dahyun Dawn Lim
admin.fact: I was a goalkeeper when I was in middle school soccer team.
admin.advice: There are a lot of wonderful performances held at Krannert Center cost only $10 for uiuc students!

admin.name: Nikhila Puppala
admin.advice: Love the learning and everything else will work out!

admin.name: Meghan Lu
admin.involvements: Percentage Project, Society of Women Engineers, Alpha Omega Epsilon, Research Park
admin.hobbies: Tennis, painting, working out, thrifting, meditation, seeing nature, eating new foods!
admin.fact: I love Brockhampton--I've seen them twice!
admin.advice: You are 100% capable and you should be confident in your ability to succeed! You don't have to know everything (or anything, really), but have a growth mindset and you will grow into the person you want to be.

admin.name: Saloni Vaishnav
admin.fact: I read over 100 books over quarantine
admin.advice: One thing I wish I'd known earlier in college is to not be afraid to join RSO's or go to their events. Most of the time the members are welcoming and inclusive and its good to explore so you can find what you really like.
